Report No* 1
To: NAEB BOARD OF DIRECTORS 11-17-54
From: Frank E* Schooley
Res Presidential Activities, etc*
lo It is the intention of the president to issue these reports
from time to time, in much the same form as this* They’ll be
numbered, dated, and subject matters indicated*
2* Also, I hope to keep abreast of more or less routine board
matters by mail* I’ll use a form and ballot, and will furnish
second copy of ballot if you care to use same for records* Personally,
I’d think it would save file space if you’d indicate your votes on
recommendation sheet* But you’ll get two copies on first mailing
so you can judge what you wish to do*
3* Treasurer gob Coleman and I had thorough going over of problems
relating to the treasurer’s duties, obligations, and financial
practices of NAEB. No doubt, Bob will have many questions from
time to time. However, we did agree on a number of things, vfoich
I’ll list here:
a* Schooley will retain duties of treasurer to Jan* 1, 1955*
b« Schooley will transmit funds in approximate amount of
$40,000 shortly before first of new year* Balance after
Jan* I*
Co Schooley will handle all deposits, disbursements through
December 31, 1954; Coleman all transactions beginning
J an o 1 o
do Coleman will furnish request for Board approval of
depository designation*
e, Coleman will seek Board approval of bonding in amount
of $40,000 *
fo Schooley will prepare and mail all statements up to
January 1, and including mailing of statements for 1955
dues*
go Normally, all revenues and bills for payments will pass
through headquarters. Revenues will simply be mailed on*
Bills will have appropriate notations, such as account to
which they should be charged, and approval of proper
authority in headquarters0
I think I’ve stated most matters of importance that we discussed, and
I believe I’ve reported correctly our agreements. As I say, we’ll
probably meet again or discuss again many situations until Bob
learns the complexities of operations*
4* While in Ann Arbor for the Illinois-Michigan football game (which,
I need not tell you, Illinois lost) had lunch with Waldo, Garnet,
Ed Staheff, and Ed Willis* Also visited Center offices and all
staffers*
5* Page 1 is running out and I hope to hold as many reports to one
page as is possible, so I stop on page 1, report 1*
cc: Skornia
